mechanics.condition: Caster chooses a location within range that has been seen before
mechanics.outcome: An illusory copy of the caster appears at the chosen location, lasting for the duration

mechanics.condition: Interaction is with the Project Image illusion
mechanics.outcome: Physical objects pass through the illusion (it is intangible)

mechanics.condition: Damage is dealt to the Project Image illusion
mechanics.outcome: The illusion disappears, and the spell ends
The image moves up to twice the caster's speed, can gesture, speak, and mimic caster's mannerisms

mechanics.trigger: Caster uses Bonus Action on their turn
mechanics.condition: Caster chooses to switch senses to/from the image
mechanics.outcome: Caster sees and hears through the image's senses; Caster is Blinded and Deafened to their own surroundings

mechanics.trigger: Creature physically interacts with the image
mechanics.condition: Interaction is with the Project Image illusion
mechanics.outcome: The creature perceives the image to be an illusion due to its intangibility

mechanics.trigger: Creature uses an Action to examine the image
mechanics.condition: Creature succeeds on an Intelligence (Investigation) check against the caster's spell save DC
mechanics.outcome: The creature determines the image is an illusion

mechanics.trigger: Creature discerns the Project Image illusion
mechanics.condition: Creature knows the image is an illusion
mechanics.outcome: The creature can see through the image, and any noise it makes sounds hollow to that creature

description_text: You create an illusory copy of yourself that lasts for the duration. The copy can appear at any location within range that you have seen before, regardless of intervening obstacles. The illusion looks and sounds like you but is intangible. If the illusion takes any damage, it disappears, and the spell ends.You can use your action to move this illusion up to twice your speed, and make it gesture, speak, and behave in whatever way you choose. It mimics your mannerisms perfectly.You can see through its eyes and hear through its ears as if you were in its space. On your turn as a bonus action, you can switch from using its senses to using your own, or back again. While you are using its senses, you are blinded and deafened in regard to your own surroundings.Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it. A creature that uses its action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and any noise it makes sounds hollow to the creature.
